For Indonesian artist Imelda Adams (@imeldaams), her artwork is an opportunity for self-expression and to share inspiration for positive action.â£
â£
â€œEvery huge change ahead always starts with a small step,â€ she explains. â€œSomething that may not matter to us may be meaningful to others.â€â£
â£
This #MonthOfGood, Imelda is spending her time painting at home and catching up with family. Share your moments of everyday kindness and good using the hashtag #MonthOfGood, then tag three people to do the same.â£

#HelloFrom a Futuro House. Weâ€™re dreaming of this out-of-this-world structure, tucked into the Caucasus Mountains. ğŸŒ¼â£
â£
Designed by Finnish architect Matti Suuronen, there is nothing supernatural about this flying saucer. Less than 100 of these prefabricated â€œportableâ€ ski chalets were built in Finland, and this particular pod first landed on the Mussa-Achitara ridge in the 1970s. â£
â£
Today, you can find Futuro Houses around the world, and the one in Dombay is a functioning hotel.â£
â£
Photo by @ted.ns

Once special makeup artist Amazing JIRO (@amazing_jiro) realized he wouldnâ€™t be applying makeup to others due to shelter-in-place rules, he came up with an inventive solution which was (literally) close at hand: #onehandmonster.â£
â£
â€œItâ€™s a cheerful, fun art activity aimed at those who are unable to leave their homes,â€ says JIRO. â€œI hoped that I could improve their gloomy moods a bit, so I came up with the theme of monsters that eat gloomy feelings.â€â£
â£
â€œUsing the motifs of animals everyone was familiar with was sure to evoke empathy, and I thought it would be even more interesting if I added a bit of imagination to turn these animals into new, original characters â€” a tiger with the markings of a hippo and a giraffe, a bird with the skin texture of a dinosaur,â€ he explains. â£
â£
â€œEven during times of hardship, we can cheer ourselves up and save ourselves by using imagination.â€ #ThisWeekOnInstagramâ£
â£
Photos by @amazing_jiro

Meet artist Pete Cromerâ€™s (@petecromer) hand-painted â€œDruids.â€ Pete casts molds of pebbles and stones â€œborrowed from nature,â€ then re-creates them from concrete, resin and glitter.â£
â£
â€œIâ€™m drawn to the idea of materials, like stone, that last through civilizations like in ancient cultures. Some people believe stones hold certain types of energy. The Druids, in my case, hold positive energy,â€ he says.â£
â£
â€œI started making the Druids shortly after I left my full-time job to pursue my artistic endeavors. I created them to place around my home, so I felt others were there with me, like a cheer squad â€” for support, warmth and happiness. They were reassurance that things were going to be OK,â€ he says. â€œI call them bright souls because they are all about positivity and making you feel happy.â€ â£

Doll artist Anna Nazarenkoâ€™s (@awesome_oso) menagerie of handmade, hybrid creatures includes broccoli sheep and Milky Way cows, and yes, banana cats. â€œI love mixing different things and literally anything will become a cute creature if you add a kitty face on it ğŸ˜Š,â€ she says. â€œI take inspiration from various shapes but itâ€™s dull to just sculpt a banana, right?â€â£

A postcard in the mail is its own kind of special. ğŸ’Œâ£

Thatâ€™s why Yasmin Reddig and Sue Hiepler of the creative shop @mayandberry are teaching us how to make our very own postcard, complete with super-cute illustrations and easy-to-do calligraphy. âœ¨ğŸ‘ŒğŸ’•ğŸ™Œâ£
â£
â€œOur artworks are a mix of illustration and hand-lettering,â€ Sue says. â€œWe try to keep it fresh, modern and simple. Everything that has to do with floral motives, urban watercolor and colorful letterings.â€â£
â£
The duo founded their small business over three years ago after meeting at an art design market in Bonn, Germany. Now, as @mayandberry, they co-design postcards, prints and calendars, as well as conduct workshops and post tutorials online. â€œWe are extremely grateful to call May & Berry our job,â€ Yasmin says.â£
â£
Today, Yasmin and Sue are here to share their skills. To #TryThisAtHome, check out our story.â£

Video by @mayandberry
